com.adroll.cantor

Class HLLCounter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.adroll.cantor.HLLCounter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class HLLCounter
extends Object
implements Serializable
    HLLCounter allows for cardinality estimation of large sets with a compact data structure.

    For guidance on setting precisions for a desired level of error, see the package info.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HLLCounter()
      Constructs a non-intersectable HLLCounter that can be used to estimate the cardinality of a set of items with precision DEFAULT_P.
      HLLCounter(boolean intersectable)
      Constructs an HLLCounter that can be used to estimate the cardinality of a set of items with DEFAULT_P and, if intersectable is true, DEFAULT_K.
      HLLCounter(boolean intersectable, int k)
      Constructs an HLLCounter that can be used to estimate the cardinality of a set of items with DEFAULT_P and, if intersectable is true, specified k.
      HLLCounter(byte p)
      Constructs a non-intersectable HLLCounter object that can be used to estimate the cardinality of a set of items with given precision.
      HLLCounter(byte p, boolean intersectable)
      Constructs an HLLCounter that can be used to estimate the cardinality of a set of items with specified precision and, if intersectable is true, k is a reasonable precision guess based on p.
      HLLCounter(byte p, boolean intersectable, int k)
      Constructs an HLLCounterthat can be used to estimate the cardinality of a set of items with specified precision and, if intersectable is true, specified k.
      HLLCounter(byte p, boolean intersectable, int k, byte[] M, TreeSet<Long> ts)
      Constructs an HLLCounter that can be used to estimate the cardinality of a set of items with specified precision and, if intersectable is true, specified k, along with pre-computed HLL and MinHash structures.

      • HLLCounter

        public HLLCounter(byte p)
        Constructs a non-intersectable HLLCounter object that can be used to estimate the cardinality of a set of items with given precision.
        Parameters:
        p - the byte precision of the HLL structure, MIN_P <= p <= MAX_P

        public HLLCounter(byte p,
          boolean intersectable)
        Constructs an HLLCounter that can be used to estimate the cardinality of a set of items with specified precision and, if intersectable is true, k is a reasonable precision guess based on p.
        Parameters:
        p - the byte precision of the HLL structure, MIN_P <= p <= MAX_P
        intersectable - boolean to make the structure intersectable

        k - the int precision of MinHash structure

        intersectable - boolean to make the structure intersectable
        k - the int precision of MinHash structure

      • HLLCounter

        public HLLCounter(byte p,
          boolean intersectable,
          int k,
          byte[] M,
          TreeSet<Long> ts)
        Constructs an HLLCounter that can be used to estimate the cardinality of a set of items with specified precision and, if intersectable is true, specified k, along with pre-computed HLL and MinHash structures.

        One should only use this constructor when absolutely necessary, for example to copy one HLLCounter's fields into a new HLLCounter.

        Parameters:
        p - the byte precision of the HLL structure, MIN_P <= p <= MAX_P
        intersectable - boolean to make the structure intersectable
        k - the int precision of MinHash structure
        M - the byte[] HLL structure of length 2^p
        ts - the TreeSet<Long> MinHash structure of length k

    • Method Detail

      • put

        public void put(String v)
        Insert an element into the HLLCounter structure.

        The String v is hashed to a long, which, by the HLL algorithm is inserted in the HLL byte[].

        Additionally, if this HLLCounter is intersectable, the long is added to the MinHash TreeSet<Long> if it is one of the k least longs seen thus far.

        Parameters:
        v - the String to insert

      • put

        public void put(String... vs)
        Insert multiple elements into the HLLCounter structure.

        This iterates the put(String v) method.

        Parameters:
        vs - the String... elements to insert

      • size

        public long size()
        Returns the estimated number of unique insertions into the HLLCounter structure.

        For sets of cardinality less than k, this is exact.

        Returns:
        the long estimated size of unique insertions

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clears all data in the HLL and MinHash structures.

      • combine

        public void combine(HLLCounter h)
        Performs a destructive union of this HLLCounter and the one passed in.

        This HLLCounter will now contain data that is equivalent to all insertions from both HLLCounters going into a single HLLCounter. The precisions of this HLLCounter will be the smaller of the precisions between each HLLCounter.

        Parameters:
        h - the HLLCounter to combine into this one

      • combine

        public void combine(HLLCounter... hs)
        Performs a destructive union of this HLLCounter and all the ones passed in.

        This iterates the combine(HLLCounter h) method.

        Parameters:
        hs - the HLLCounter... to combine into this one

      • fold

        public void fold(byte q)
        Reduces the precision from p to q.
        Parameters:
        q - the byte new precision

        Returns:
        the boolean that indicates whether this is intersectable

      • getMinHash

        public TreeSet<Long> getMinHash()
        Returns the raw MinHash structure.
        Returns:
        the TreeSet<Long> of the k least elements hashed

      • getK

        public int getK()
        Returns the precision of the MinHash structure.
        Returns:
        the int precision of MinHash

      • intersect

        public static long intersect(HLLCounter... hs)
        Returns an estimate of the size of the intersection of the given HLLCounters.

        This method only works for intersectable HLLCounters. It doesn't actually perform an intersection, but rather returns an estimate of the cardinality of the intersection.

        It calculates a global MinHash structure based on the minimum MinHash precision k across all the structures. A global HLL structure is also computed with the minimum precision across all structures. That is, the estimate's only as accurate as the least accurate HLLCounter.

        Parameters:
        hs - the HLLCounter... to "intersect"
        Returns:
        the long estimate of the intersection cardinality

      • safeUnion

        public static byte[] safeUnion(byte[] Q,
               byte[] R)
        Returns an HLL structure that is the effective union of two other HLL structures.

        This method is primarily used for non-destructive unions, unlike the combine(HLLCounter h) method.

        Parameters:
        Q - the byte[] first HLL structure to union
        R - the byte[] second HLL structure to union
        Returns:
        the byte[] HLL structure of the union
